009package Ch11_Circles_Ellipses;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.algebraic.CircleFitAlgebraic.FitType.Pratt;
012import static imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.geometric.CircleFitGeometric.FitType.DistanceBased;
013import static imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.askYesOrCancel;
014import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
015
016import java.util.Locale;
017
018import ij.IJ;
019import ij.ImagePlus;
020import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
021import ij.gui.Overlay;
022import ij.gui.Roi;
023import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
024import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
025import imagingbook.common.color.sets.BasicAwtColor;
026import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
027import imagingbook.common.geometry.circle.GeometricCircle;
028import imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.algebraic.CircleFitAlgebraic;
029import imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.geometric.CircleFitGeometric;
030import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
031import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
032import imagingbook.common.ij.RoiUtils;
033import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
034import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
035
036
037/**
038 * <p>
039 * ImageJ plugin, performs algebraic circle fitting on the current ROI to find
040 * an initial circle, followed by geometric fitting. Algebraic and geometric fitting
041 * methods can be selected (see Sec. 11.1 of [1] for details). If successful,
042 * the resulting ellipses are displayed as a vector overlay (color can be
043 * chosen). Sample points are either collected from the ROI (if available) or
044 * collected as foreground pixels (values &gt; 0) from the image. If no image is
045 * currently open, the user is asked to create a suitable sample image.
046 * </p>
047 * <p>
048 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
049 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
050 * </p>
051 * 
052 * @author WB
053 * @version 2022/10/03
054 */
055public class Circle_Fitting implements PlugInFilter {
056        
057        static CircleFitAlgebraic.FitType AlgebraicFitMethod = Pratt;
058        static CircleFitGeometric.FitType GeometricFitMethod = DistanceBased;
059        static boolean UsePointsFromRoi = false;
060        
061        private static BasicAwtColor AlgebraicFitColor = BasicAwtColor.Red;
062        private static BasicAwtColor GeometricFitColor = BasicAwtColor.Blue;
063        private static double StrokeWidth = 0.5;
064        
065        private ImagePlus im;
066        
067        /**
068         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image
069         * is currently open.
070         */
071        public Circle_Fitting() {
072                if (noCurrentImage()) {
073                        if (askYesOrCancel("Create sample image", "No image is currently open.\nCreate a sample image?")) {
074                                IjUtils.run(new Circle_Make_Random()); //runPlugIn(Circle_Make_Random.class);
075                        }                       
076                }
077        }
078        
079        @Override
080        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
081                this.im = im;
082                return DOES_ALL;
083        }
084
085        @Override
086        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
087                Roi roi = im.getRoi();
088                UsePointsFromRoi = (roi != null);
089                
090                if (!runDialog()) {
091                        return;
092                }
093                
094                Pnt2d[] points = (UsePointsFromRoi) ?
095                                RoiUtils.getOutlinePointsFloat(roi) :
096                                IjUtils.collectNonzeroPoints(ip);
097                
098                IJ.log("Found points " + points.length);
099                if (points.length < 3) {
100                        IJ.error("At least 3 points are required, but found only " + points.length);
101                        return;
102                }
103                
104                Overlay oly = im.getOverlay();
105                if (oly == null) {
106                        oly = new Overlay();
107                        im.setOverlay(oly);
108                }       
109                ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter(oly); 
110                
111                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
112                CircleFitAlgebraic fitA = CircleFitAlgebraic.getFit(AlgebraicFitMethod, points);
113                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
114                
115                GeometricCircle ac = fitA.getGeometricCircle();
116                if (ac == null) {
117                        IJ.log("Algebraic fit: no result!");
118                        return;
119                }
120                
121                GeometricCircle initCircle = ac;
122                
123                IJ.log("Initial fit (algebraic):");
124                IJ.log("  circle: " + initCircle.toString());
125                IJ.log(String.format(Locale.US, "  error = %.3f", initCircle.getMeanSquareError(points)));
126                
127                ColoredStroke initialStroke = new ColoredStroke(StrokeWidth, AlgebraicFitColor.getColor());
128                ola.addShapes(initCircle.getShapes(3), initialStroke);
129
130                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
131                CircleFitGeometric fitG = CircleFitGeometric.getFit(GeometricFitMethod, points, initCircle);
132                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
133                
134                GeometricCircle finalCircle = fitG.getCircle();
135                if (finalCircle == null) {
136                        IJ.log("Geometric fit: no result!");
137                        return;
138                }
139                
140                IJ.log("Final fit (geometric):");
141                IJ.log("  circle: " + finalCircle.toString());
142                IJ.log(String.format(Locale.US, "  error = %.3f", finalCircle.getMeanSquareError(points)));
143                IJ.log("  iterations = " + fitG.getIterations());
144
145                ColoredStroke finalStroke = new ColoredStroke(StrokeWidth, GeometricFitColor.getColor());
146                ola.addShapes(finalCircle.getShapes(3), finalStroke);
147        }
148
149        // ------------------------------------------
150        
151        private boolean runDialog() {
152                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
153                
154                gd.addMessage(DialogUtils.makeLineSeparatedString(
155                                "This plugin performs algebraic + geometric circle fitting,",
156                                "either to ROI points (if available) or foreground points",
157                                "collected from the pixel image."
158                                ));
159                
160                gd.addCheckbox("Use ROI (float) points", UsePointsFromRoi);
161                gd.addEnumChoice("Algebraic fit method", AlgebraicFitMethod);
162                gd.addEnumChoice("Algebraic ellipse color", AlgebraicFitColor);
163                gd.addEnumChoice("Geometric fit method", GeometricFitMethod);
164                gd.addEnumChoice("Geometric ellipse color", GeometricFitColor);
165                
166                gd.showDialog();
167                if (gd.wasCanceled())
168                        return false;
169                
170                UsePointsFromRoi = gd.getNextBoolean();
171                AlgebraicFitMethod = gd.getNextEnumChoice(CircleFitAlgebraic.FitType.class);
172                AlgebraicFitColor = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
173                GeometricFitMethod = gd.getNextEnumChoice(CircleFitGeometric.FitType.class);
174                GeometricFitColor = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
175                
176                return true;
177        }
178
179
180
181}
